Title: TS16023 - Supply of an Internally Hosted Asset and Facilities Management Solution with Associated Services
Description:
The Council is looking to procure a single Internally Hosted Asset and Facilities Management Solution with Associated Services for its Corporate Resources Property Division, to facilitate efficient management of its land and property portfolio. 

The Solution needs to provide Asset Management and Facilities Management functions including collection and retention of common property data and health and safety and statutory compliance data. It needs to be flexible, suitable for a Local Authority client, user friendly and able to interface with other software packages such as Computer Aided Design (CAD), Geographic Information System (GIS) mapping systems, and potentially Building Information Modelling (BIM) software.

The Solution needs to be web enabled and accessible from any Council location despite varying levels of mobile network coverage. It will be internally hosted within the Council's own data centres.

Associated Services include, but are not limited to: implementation; data migration; support and maintenance; training and skills/knowledge transfer; and account management.

Tenderers must note that benchmarking indicates this requirement can be delivered below the OJEU threshold of £164,176. Therefore, any submissions that do not fall below this figure for the Total Contract Value, including optional requirements and possible extensions, will be deemed non-compliant.

The initial contract period is 4 years, with options to extend on an annual basis to take the term up to a maximum of 7 years.

Title: External Quality Assessments
Description:
To carry out an External Quality Assessment (EQA) as required by the Public Sector Internal Audit Standards (PSIAS) and Local Government Application Note (LGAN) for each of the Internal Audit Teams as detailed in this document below. 

The required work will be to undertake a review and validation of the self-assessments against the PSIAS which have been produced by the Chief Audit Executive (CAE) for each of the Internal Audit Functions at their respective authorities and in addition provide a comparison in respect of best practice.

Staffordshire Chief Auditors Group (SCAG) have come together to procure an assessor(s) to carry out the EQA on each of our teams as required by PSIAS/LGAN. The group is also looking to achieve shared learning and promotion of best practice via a common and consistent independent EQA. 

The Internal Audit functions that are included for review in this specification are:

•	Cannock Chase District Council/Stafford Borough Council
•	Newcastle Under Lyme Borough Council
•	Stoke on Trent City Council
•	Tamworth Borough Council/Lichfield District Council
•	Staffordshire Moorlands District Council/High Peak Borough Council
•	Staffordshire County Council/Staffordshire Fire & Rescue
•	South Staffordshire District Council
•	Shropshire Council
•	Telford & Wrekin Council

More information on each Internal Audit function is contained in Annex 1 of the specification
Additional Text: User guide attached for County Council etendering system, where this opportunity is available
